query: Analyze replacement demand dynamics for USA datacenter UPS from 2025-2040. Show the breakdown between new-build and replacement demand, and explain how the contestable VRLA market drives Li-ion adoption
expected_behavior: Step 1: Runs forecast for USA with detailed demand decomposition
Step 2: Tracks installed base separately for VRLA and Li-ion
Step 3: Calculates retirement rates based on technology lifespans (VRLA: 5yr, Li-ion: 12yr)
Step 4: Identifies contestable market (VRLA reaching end-of-life that can switch to Li-ion)
Step 5: Decomposes total demand into new-build, VRLA replacement, and Li-ion replacement
Step 6: Uses extract_metrics.py to generate replacement breakdown analysis
Shows that 2025-2028 demand is ~70% new-build, ~30% replacement (VRLA only)
Post-tipping point (2029+): contestable VRLA market switches to Li-ion at replacement
By 2035: replacement demand is ~70-75% of total (installed base maturation)
2035 replacement split: ~60% Li-ion replacements, ~15% VRLA replacements (legacy holdouts)
Demonstrates that Li-ion installed base builds up slowly due to 12-year life (low retirement initially)
VRLA installed base peaks around 2027-2028, then declines as units convert to Li-ion at 5-year replacement
Contestable market is key mechanism: new datacenters choose Li-ion, VRLA switches at EOL
Shows 5-7 year transition lag from tipping point (2028) to high Li-ion share (2033-2035)
New-build demand grows steadily at datacenter growth rate (7-10% CAGR)
Total demand accelerates 2030-2035 as first wave of VRLA reaches replacement cycle
Output demonstrates importance of installed base accounting for technology transitions
